result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Kuhlmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Unpaid Court costs/fees are converted to a Civil Judgment - signed by SLH
from PO Tom Pierzina   re: Sentencing after Revocation / Revocation summary

3:31 PM - Def in court, in custody.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Def: my atty is Huh. Crt calls SPD office and leaves msg. Crt: it would make sense for him to be here. Def: I thought all these would be done together. I think I am ready to go today w/o him. I won't fight anything. SULESKI: I don't have anything to add. I agree w/ the DOC. DEF: I have a sub abuse problem. I am doing what I can. 
SENTENCE: as to counts 1 & 6 - def to serve 6 mos CJ first 90 days w/o release - balance to be served on EM thru JSS w/ credit for  76 days to be applied toward the confinement and good time proportionately. Ct. 3 -  def to serve 76 days CJ w/ credit for 76 days - concurrent w/ Cts. 1 & 6 - financial obligations to be converted to a civil J. EJSS
PO is Tom Pierzina

9:00 AM - Def in court w/Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Complaint filed
Ct. 1 - Child neglect w/o repeater - Guilty
Ct. 3 - DC w/o repeater - Guilty
Ct. 6 - BJ w/o repeater - Guilty
remaining charges dismissed and read in
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs  
Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Keller: asking for probation. Fairly lengthy criminal hx. Treatment needs
O'Neil: he's close to gettting his GED. The kids were returned on 3/16. He has tried over the past 2-3 yrs he's tried on is own to get into recovery although there have been relapses and he's lost the friends that were users. 
Def: Am sorry that this has affected my kids and I am glad it's moving in the way it is. I have become more family oriented and realized that I was putting myself b/f my kids. Doing better in my job
Crt: seem to be remorseful and I have to acknow you are making strides
SENTENCE:
Sentence withheld - 12  mos probation
Cond:   Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  The def is not to consume any alc and/or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx. Random testing. Comply w/ CPS orders and recommendations. 25 hrs com service. Credit for 3 days. Pay DOC fees & CC.
Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.

2:17 PM - Def in court w/Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JSS 2/25 report indicating violations. JSS gave informal sanctions for early violations and then ref'd it back to court for subsequent violations
O'Neil: his understanding was he tested clean on the 2 days that says tampering.  He's also testing for a case involving his children. 
Crt: the standards are conservative - it takes a sig consumption of fluids to be tampering. I have no objections to the ones for alc but THC, I haven't been smoking it.  I have made sure to drink 2 big cups of water for testing. 
Keller: asking for cash bond. violations since release from custody. JSS tried informal consequences and the court set this a couple days ago and there have been further violations. 
Def: AODA is set for 4/1 to be done at Mayo.  I can take a UA now.
Crt: as to the denial, I will rely on the test results. You can have a confirmatory test sent in but today I will tighten the bond conditons but if there's any further violations there will be a cash bond
HOUSE ARREST TO BE ENFORCED THRU EM - TO BE OUT FOR EMPLOYMENT AND COMPLIANCE W/ CHIPS CASE, MEETINGS W/ ATTY,  AND TO COMPLY W/ JSS CONDITIONS INCLUDING TESTING sign releases to JSS is aware of the results of the assmt and comply w/ the terms and conditions of the AODA recommendations. If you are in bond compliance thru  4/1 we can revisit the  bond conditions. 
ejs
